channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Week in pictures: From Brazil floods to spectacular northern lights
item.description: A look at of some of last week's events.

item.title: How the US State Department shields Israel from sanctions
item.description: Inside the labyrinth of the State Department's mechanisms that allow the flow of weapons to Israel, despite violations.

item.title: Chile’s Tabilo beats top-seeded Djokovic in massive upset at Italian Open
item.description: Djokovic's 6-2, 6-3 straight sets loss extends his tournament drought in 2024.

item.title: Egypt says it will join South Africa’s genocide case against Israel at ICJ
item.description: Cairo says the move is due to Israel's worsening attacks against civilians in Gaza.

item.title: Egypt deals ‘diplomatic blow’ to Israel by joining ICJ genocide case
item.description: Egypt says it will formally support South Africa’s genocide case against Israel at the International Court of Justice.

item.title: Israel pounds northern Gaza, months after declaring Hamas dismantled
item.description: Israeli forces have launched a new offensive in northern Gaza, months after saying Hamas had been ‘dismantled’ there.

item.title: UN chief urges ‘immediate ceasefire’ in Gaza as 35,000 Palestinians killed
item.description: Israeli forces launch more attacks on Jabalia refugee camp in northern Gaza as they increase pressure on Rafah.

item.title: Berkeley chancellor speaks out about ‘Gaza brutality’ at graduation
item.description: Chancellor of UC Berkeley addressed the ‘brutality of the violence in Gaza’ in her graduation ceremony speech.

item.title: How US Big Tech supports Israel’s AI-powered genocide and apartheid
item.description: As an extension of US imperial power, US tech corporations are eager to support Israeli atrocities.

item.title: How do you hold the powerful accountable? – Alam and Feinstein
item.description: Photojournalist Shahidul Alam and corruption expert Andrew Feinstein on the journey into activism and the Gaza crisis.

item.title: Northern lights illuminate night skies around the world
item.description: Solar flares sparked the biggest geomagnetic storm in two decades, causing spectacular auroras around the world.

item.title: Masked Tunisian police arrest prominent lawyer for media comments
item.description: Masked police are filmed storming the premises of the Bar Association's Lawyers' House to arrest lawyer Sonia Dahmani.

item.title: Indonesia’s Prabowo: Victory, controversies and hopes
item.description: An exclusive interview with the Indonesian president-elect as he prepares to take the reins of power.

item.title: Lithuania holds presidential election amid concerns over Russia-Ukraine war
item.description: Baltic state of 2.8 million people fears it could be next in Russia's crosshairs if Moscow wins its war against Ukraine.

item.title: Boos inside and protests outside Eurovision final over Israel’s act
item.description: Israel’s performance at Eurovision was booed by spectators inside the venue, while protesters were outside the venue.

item.title: Nepal’s ‘Everest Man’ beats own record by climbing summit for 29th time
item.description: Kami Rita and fellow Sherpa guide Pasang Dawa have been competing for the title of most climbs of Everest.

item.title: Catalonia elections to gauge push for split or reconciliation with Spain
item.description: Opinion polls suggest a comfortable lead for a candidate backed by Socialist Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez.

item.title: Ukraine’s Lomachenko knocks out Kambosos to win IBF lightweight crown
item.description: Two-time Olympic gold medallist 'Loma' stopped home favourite George Kambosos in the 11th round of the fight in Perth.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 808
item.description: As the war enters its 808th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: Fourth Indian arrested and charged in Canada over Sikh activist’s killing
item.description: Amandeep Singh was already in custody for unrelated gun charges before being charged in Hardeep Singh Nijjar's murder.

item.title: ‘Climbing is for ladies too’: Transforming Malawi into a climbers’ paradise
item.description: A small group of enterprising, local climbers has a bold cause - to attract more Malawians to the sport.

item.title: At least 28 dead, several missing in Indonesia flash floods, cold lava flow
item.description: Heavy rain triggers a flash flood and a cold lava flow from Mount Marapi, resulting in the disaster in West Sumatra.

item.title: NBA playoffs: Stars shine for Celtics, Mavericks in Game 3 victories
item.description: Celtics score 106-93 comeback win over Cavs, while Luka Doncic-led Mavericks beat OKC Thunder 105-101.

item.title: India Lok Sabha election 2024 Phase 4: Who votes and what’s at stake?
item.description: People from across 10 states and union territories will vote on May 13 to elect 96 MPs for the Lok Sabha.

item.title: Guardians of the glaciers – life alongside Pakistan’s vanishing ice
item.description: The rapid melting of Pakistan’s icy giants is creating hardships and challenges for vulnerable communities.
